abstract: Jerry Yang explained his company’s rejection of Microsoft’s buyout offer in a letter to shareholders late Wednesday outlining why he believed the bid was too low.
snippet: Jerry Yang explained his company’s rejection of Microsoft’s buyout offer in a letter to shareholders late Wednesday outlining why he believed the bid was too low.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Jerry Yang, the chief executive of Yahoo, explained his company’s rejection of Microsoft’s buyout offer in a letter to shareholders late Wednesday outlining why he believed the bid, initially valued at $44.6 billion, was too low.

headline.main: Yahoo Chief Explains Rejection of Microsoft Bid

abstract: If you spend too much time pointing and clicking just to read your Gmail on the Web, check out Google’s set of keyboard shortcuts.
snippet: If you spend too much time pointing and clicking just to read your Gmail on the Web, check out Google’s set of keyboard shortcuts.
lead_paragraph: If you spend too much time pointing and clicking just to read your Gmail on the Web, check out Google’s set of keyboard shortcuts. Log into your Gmail account, click the Settings link and go to the General tab to enable keyboard shortcuts. Click the Learn More link to see a list of what you can do on the keyboard  or just click Save Changes and then type a question mark to see a list pop up on screen. Once you learn them, keyboard shortcuts can save time and mouse work  for example, just type an exclamation mark to tag an open message as spam and remove it from your In box.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Google’s Keyboard Shortcuts.

abstract: Many Yahoo shareholders are waiting for a higher bid than that offered by Microsoft, but analysts say it is increasingly unlikely.
snippet: Many Yahoo shareholders are waiting for a higher bid than that offered by Microsoft, but analysts say it is increasingly unlikely.
lead_paragraph: Can Yahoo avoid being gobbled up by Microsoft?

headline.main: Little Room for Yahoo to Maneuver
headline.print_headline: Little Room For Yahoo To Maneuver

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Andrew Ross Sorkin

abstract: Is there a way to move the Microsoft Outlook file (e-mails, contacts and calendars) between a PC and a Mac?
snippet: Is there a way to move the Microsoft Outlook file (e-mails, contacts and calendars) between a PC and a Mac?
lead_paragraph: Q. I am thinking of buying a MacBook to replace my Windows laptop. Is there a way to move the Microsoft Outlook file (e-mails, contacts and calendars) between a PC and a Mac?

headline.main: Moving Outlook: Mail to a Mac

abstract: Office Live Small Business gives the nation’s 25 million small businesses the same online tools that the big boys use, and it shows Microsoft can still produce fresh ideas and polished work.
snippet: Office Live Small Business gives the nation’s 25 million small businesses the same online tools that the big boys use, and it shows Microsoft can still produce fresh ideas and polished work.
lead_paragraph: So Microsoft is making a hostile bid for Yahoo.

headline.main: A Little Piece of Microsoft Aids Small Business
headline.print_headline: Mom and Pop Get a Partner: Microsoft

abstract: What’s the difference between sharing a PC on an Administrator user account and a Limited user account?
snippet: What’s the difference between sharing a PC on an Administrator user account and a Limited user account?
lead_paragraph: Q. What’s the difference between sharing a PC on an Administrator user account and a Limited user account? Is there any advantage to using one over the other?

headline.main: Limiting Power on a Shared PC

abstract: Can Yahoo avoid being gobbled up by Microsoft? Many analysts say it is increasingly unlikely.
lead_paragraph: Can Yahoo avoid being gobbled up by Microsoft? Many analysts say it is increasingly unlikely.

headline.main: Little Room for Yahoo to Maneuver

abstract: In what may be a sign that its investor base is growing restless, Yahoo sent a letter from its chief executive, Jerry Yang, to shareholders Wednesday explaining the Web company’s decision to turn down a takeover offer from Microsoft and laying out its turnaround strategy.
lead_paragraph: In what may be a sign that its investor base is growing restless, Yahoo sent a letter from its chief executive, Jerry Yang, to shareholders Wednesday explaining the Web company’s decision to turn down a takeover offer from Microsoft and laying out its turnaround strategy.

headline.main: Yahoo Makes Its Case to Shareholders
